PSO1. Analytical Thinking : Develop the ability to understand and apply abstract and quantitative concepts in Economics and Statistics, leading to theories and models that explain economic phenomena.
PSO2. Problem Analysis and Solution Design: Identify, analyse, and design solutions for real-world economic issues using fundamental principles of Economics, Statistics, and related domain disciplines.
PSO3. Proficiency in Statistical Tools : Acquire the skills to use statistical software and tools for data analysis, economic forecasting, and interpretation of economic trends across various sectors.
PSO4. Professional Ethics and Social Responsibility : Understand and adhere to ethical standards, including data integrity, privacy regulations, and norms of professional practices in economic and statistical research.
PSO5. Research and Data Analysis : Utilise research-based methods, including data collection, statistical analysis, and interpretation, to draw valid conclusions about economic trends and behaviours.
PSO6. Effective Teamwork and Collaboration: Function efficiently as an individual and as a team member or leader in diverse teams and multidisciplinary environments, particularly in economic research and data analysis projects.
PSO7. Application Across Multidisciplinary Domains: Understand the role of statistical approaches and economic theories, applying them to solve real-life problems in fields like finance, policy-making, business, and development.
PSO8. Project Management in Economic Research : Apply statistical and economic knowledge to analyse, design, and manage projects aimed at solving complex issues in economics and related areas.
Basic eligibility for the programme is a pass at the +2 level (Maharashtra PUC / ISC / CBSE / NIOS / State Boards) in any stream with minimum score of 50%.
Candidates writing the +2 examinations in March-May 2025 may apply with their class X and XI marks.
Students pursuing an International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
